alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island; Northern Outer Banks (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued May 25 at 8:48PM EDT until May 27 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM FRIDAY TO 8 PM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, dangerous rip currents, large breaking waves, and strong longshore currents in the surf zone. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 6 to 12 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...The beaches north of Cape Hatteras. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Friday evening. For the High Surf Advisory, from 5 PM Friday to 8 PM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Dangerous shore break can throw a swimmer or surfer head first into the bottom causing neck and back injuries. Strong longshore currents will create dangerous swimming conditions.
info.instruction: Swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
